intro: Hieracium borreri, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in harsh, cold environments. Its leaves are basal, with a rough texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium borreri is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to withstand strong winds and low temperatures.
